intro: Baloghia carunculata, commonly known as the red-stemmed baloghia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, often pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters, with distinctive red stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological role in tropical ecosystems.
